• Winter Process
  • Artists

Digital Gardens

A weekend of workshops, talks, and performances exploring mechanical, algorithmic, and electronic music.

1st - 3rd September 2023

Dai 大 Hall, The Piazza, Unit 29/30, Victoria Lane, Huddersfield HD1 2QF

  • Venue address in google maps ↗(opens in new tab)

Jump to:

Friday the 1st Saturday the 2nd Sunday the 3rd

Friday 1st September

Workshops with I. Nakhla, V Buckenham, Bear Kenchington

All workshops are pay as you feel. We can take card or cash payments on the day.

  • 15.00 - 16.30: I. Nakhla

    Nakhla’s workshop will explore how audio sculptures can be assembled out of accessible, sonic archives (on phones and computers) – focusing on rhythm, improvisation, and play. Nakhla is interested in this practice as a form of ‘counter-archiving’; a way of re-appropriating, through re- using, sound and its technologies.

    Age Range: All welcome

    Necessary Experience: None

    Anything to bring: A simple recording device – phone, tablet, handheld recording device etc.

  • 16.30 - 18.00: V Buckenham

    Title: Grid That Glyph!

    Join v buckenham for an exploration of their new tool, commissioned for Digital Gardens, which puts letterforms into strange and pleasing combinations and patterns.

    Age Range: All welcome

    Necessary Experience: None

    Anything to bring: A laptop, ideally. Or a tablet, if you're comfortable writing with it (this workshop involves loading a website & typing things)

  • 18.00 - 19.30: Bear Kenchington

    Ping Pong Orchestra is a making and playing workshop, we will create a musical play park for ping pong balls. We will try to use the whole space, and an assortment of objects to explore ways to create unpredictable, percussive clusters and patterns. The balls will be the players, our job will be to build the environment they need to make music.

    Age Range: All welcome

    Necessary Experience: None

    Anything to bring: Nothing

Back to top ↑

Saturday 2nd September

  • 17.00 - 18.30: Alex McLean workshop

    A pre-performance workshop and talk about his live coding musical patterns for beginners, with the web-based Strudel environment. Anyone welcome. Bring your laptop if you like to participate in his technical workshop or you can simply come and hear.

  • 18.30: Doors

  • 19.00: Performances by:

    • Blue Ruth
    • Alex McLean
    • I. Nakhla
Back to top ↑

Sunday 3rd September

  • 17.30: Doors

  • 18.00 - 18.30: Talk by Bioni Samp

    Bioni will talk about his practice, from early beginnings with beekeeping to being inspired to become a sound artist by the Yorkshire wildlife and punk / electronic music scene.

  • 19.00: Performances by:

    • digital selves
    • Bear Kenchington
    • Bioni Samp
